rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Lectures are so confusing. Tests are take home, but graded incredibly harshly. There is an 8-10 page single spaced final paper also. Would NOT recommend.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Great class, although it is required for all environmental science and geography majors. I really enjoyed the modeling environmental systems computer lab work

He's a really nice guy who will try to help you out. He puts a lot on his website, but to do well in the class, you really have to go unless you enjoy the material. Very nice professor who is a good teacher and wants all his students to succeed.
Really nice dude, but hard to understand. Also, he's a bit on the boring side. Nevertheless, you tell he cares a lot about the class.

Great guy, one of the nicest professors around; truly cares about teaching. He can be extremely helpful if you approach him. He has a slight accent, which makes him hard to understand, but other than that, he's awesome.

May be the smartest person you will have the pleasure of listening to. Is an incredibly capable quantitative scientist. If you are interested in remote sensing and ecosystem modeling you will learn TONS from this class. Highly Recommended!
aweful
No Comments

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Mitchell is a decent professor.  He just reads off the powerpoint slides (which he posts online) and doesn't add any more information.  Only tests on what he goes over in class, though the test was a lot harder than expected.  Decent for 201 though.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: A very neat class, difficult but manageable. The texts could get fairly dry but they were generally interesting and clarified in class. He has a very unique accent that is easily understandable.

UGH.  Boring class.  I did more work in this class than ALL of my classes. I dreaded going to this class.  If you like environmental science, take it.  But if you think you are interested in city planning like I was...  THINK TWICE.

Pretty interesting teacher and class, but I don't know if this will ever be offered again.  Terminology and subject matter got repetitive by the end of the course.  Had 3-4 page papers due every couple of weeks so the workload came in short bursts. Class attendance was mandatory and we had to give powerpoint presentations during the semester.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Great professor!

Professor Castillo is engaging and you can tell he is really interested in the subject matter. He listened carefully to feedback after each exam, incorporating the feedback into how he ran the class (almost personalizing it). His lectures are long and not very interesting, but you don't necessarily have to go to class to pass. Overall great guy.

Karl is very competent. He is extremely clear, creates all the notes you will need in powerpoints, and gives you study guides. I found this class *very* easy. That being said, averages on the tests were around a 2.5-2.6 gpa (?), even after he bumps them up by 6-10%. If you're competent, you should do really well. It is an interesting course.

The best professor I have had. I took his Marine Science class first semester of my freshmen year and he made the class so amazing I declared a minor and hope to take all classes with him! He is the most caring and understanding professor there is. He always makes sure you are on the right track and tries to get to know you. Awesome professor

MASC101 and GEOL103 are the same course - Karl is not just an awesome professor, he's an awesome person. exams are easy if you follow the notes. he gives a comprehensive study guide before each exam. really understanding and willing to help anyone!
Great Professor.  Very Enthusiastic!!!
Great Professor.  Very Enthusiastic.

He is from Belize and is difficult to understand. He also didn't wear a mic in a large lecture hall, very hard to hear! When going through power points he doesn't give you time to write down all the notes!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Great lecturer and an incredible woman! Her classes are engaging and relevant. However, she is spread too thin. She doesn't have time to invest in her students outside of class or to grade assignments in a timely manner. Two-page papers not graded for 30-45 days. Reading sometimes not posted until 10:00pm night before.
I would highly recommend this class- Amy Cooke is a great lecturer and the content is extremely interesting and relevant.

Great professor. Lots of readings, but since water is my life, I loved the material we learned in the class. She's a very interesting professor and reflects passion for what she teaches. Would take another class with her! Exams can be a little ambiguous sometimes. Sometimes 3 reaaaaaaaaalllllyyyyy long readings for one night.
Dr. Cooke is very involved in what she teaches and is a great lecturer. I looked forward to going to her class. She was engaging and all of the homework was reading articles.
I love Amy Cooke! She takes a personal interest in all of her students and makes time to get to know them. She's the reason I chose to pursue environmental science. She knows her stuff, too.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Hurlbert is one of the worse professors I've had. The textbook is online and a complete waste of money. When you do the reading quizzes there is no way to check your answers until he posts them (which is not until the test comes around). He also refuses to let you make up an exam, even when you are excused for university functions. DO NOT take him.

He teaches out of this horrendous online textbook. His tests are out to trick you. In office hours, he is not particularly helpful to students. Lectures are pointless and he is not very good at explaining things

I was not looking forward to taking this class because I am not really interested in ecology or evolution, but Dr. Hurlbert is a great professor and is very good at keeping students engaged and makes sure we understand the material. Very helpful in lectures and in office hours. Tests are hard: aren't very many questions but are straight-forward.

Hurlbert is possibly the worst professor I have ever had.  He comes across as very patronizing, and his test questions have multiple correct answers, but its whichever one he feels is right. He tests out of the book on things not from lecture, which is ridiculous since there is so much reading.

This professor is the most boring professor you will ever have, especially if you are not interested in the material. He does not use the textbook at all so you have to go to every class and take extensive notes to get a good grade on his section of the exams. This class is on a curve so the exams are way harder than they need be so the curve is up

The professor should be nicer in office hours, however there is not a correlation between what he teaches in class which he teaches in class which superb; however,if you approach up to him for a question he answers your question with a question and tells you that you should know not only the material discussed in class but also in the textbook.

The professor is great in class lectures but is not very friendly in office hours when you ask questions pertaining to what you should focus. Today I went to his office and he treated me like I should not be in his course. It was just a bad experience and would warn people on the types of questions you ask. This was not a great experience.
Probably one of the most approachable professors at Carolina.  Definitely a very smart guy, although sometimes what he says might go over your head a little bit, but he is very nice and helpful.

Professor Hurlbert is AMAZING!  He is the best Bio Professor I have had at UNC!  He was on Franklin Street jumping Fires after we won during the Final Four.  He is really an amazing lecturer.  He is so interesting.  His test wasn't bad.  The average was higher than the first part of the course.  I cannot say enough how amazing he is!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Please I you love your life NEVER take this class

Bob Peet is super smart, knows his material, and lecutres old school.  Keep up, listen for intellectual humor, and work as hard as you ever thought you would.  If you want to know ecology or plants, take his class.  If you want an easy A, drop it.

DO NOT take this course. I had hoped to dig deeper into ecological issues, but all I have experienced is frustration and high expectations.  Peet's lectures are unorganized and do not convey information well. You would think after decades of teaching that he would be a proficient lecturer.  There are more things to life than your class, Bob!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Bruno is awesome! Super chill guy, great professor, and his class isn't very hard. Do the basics and you'll be fine.
Loved him
